pageContext.claim: “They're being dumped in rivers. This is a horrible thing for our country.”
pageContext.analysis: As usual, It's unclear what Trump is referring to, but once again it is an exaggerated hallucination. White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany said that Trump was talking about an investigation in Wisconsin. Some lost mail in Wisconsin was found on the side of a road and in a ditch line in Greenville, Wisconsin, a small town of about 12,000 people outside the city of Appleton. The mail was supposed to be in transit to the post office, according to the Outagamie County Sheriff's office. "Several" absentee ballots were found among three "trays" of mail, according to the sheriff's office. Wisconsin Elections Commission administrator Meagan Wolfe announced that she'd been informed by post office officials that no Wisconsin ballots were among the lost mail.
